metadata.description: Alprazalam’ references Alprazolam, the generic name for Xanax. The lyrics allude to both my friends, as well as a woman I grew up around who struggled with tranquilizer/opiate abuse. A Cancer, the sensitive crab who would never leave her bedroom (her shell) and was largely absent during my young childhood. Aside from taking inspiration from that astrological archetype, I am without hands during the entire video. Not “of this world” and trying to escape that painful reality. The visual is playful and absurd and punky, but there is a dark and melancholic undertone to both the video and song itself.

lyrics.text:
I’m alive again
Surrounded by my dearest friends
Alive again
As my eyes roll back into my head
Alive again
As my body melts into my bed
Alive again
I’m alive again
Yeah
Alprazalam
Sweet promethazine
Just a little something make you feel clean You got a lot of clutter in your head
Wake up in the morning
Go right back to bed
Time stops when you enter the room
A vision, a beauty
If you only knew
In the cool of the evening
Pastel pink and blue
The sweet summer sunset
Makes me think of you
Alprazalam
Sweet promethazine
Just a little something make you feel clean You got a lot of clutter in your head
Wake up in the morning
Go right back to bed
Just take my hand
Catch up if you can
You’re not the only one stuck in this wasteland You got a lot
Of clutter in your head
Well maybe you’d feel better
If I took you into bed
In the cool of the evening
Pastel pink and blue
Every time I blink I think of you
Alprazalam
Sweet promethazine
Just a little something make you feel clean

metadata.name: Alprazalam #1
metadata.title: Alprazalam
